snippet: The account by Syria’s delegate to the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons came as Syria began exporting the deadliest compounds.
abstract: Syria’s government says insurgents have assaulted two storage sites for some deadly chemical weapons components it has pledged to eliminate; it is the first time the Syrian authorities have reported such attacks in the three months since an international effort began to sequester and purge the country of the banned munitions.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The account by Syria’s delegate to the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons came as Syria began exporting the deadliest compounds.

headline.main: Syria Reports 2 Attacks on Chemical Arms Sites
headline.print_headline: Syria Reports 2 Attacks on Chemical Arms Sites
